Reviews.Title: “Not Bad...”
Reviews.Author: Viajero_Traveler9
Reviews.Content: ...be adviced; this hotel its really small, not what a tourist expect.... just the bed, a tiny tiny bathroom and a closet with a small fridge (no big deal); its probably recommended for a single couple ONLY since there's NO SPACE or much privacy; but if you just need a place to sleep I guess is fine; I have to say the place may NOT be in a really nice ara (meaning: its dirty and smells bad sometimes); 1 thing ..uuuhhh 8/ there are a lot of funeral arrangement stores around but like I said "if you're only need a cheap place to sleep, its fine", transportation is nearby and veeery easy to get to places....(back to the hotel) .. yeah the place is really small but I gotta say it was really clean and the front dest people were nice... in conclusion... don't get scared but you really "GET WHAT YOU PAY"... and its "NOT BAD". I hope this will help, be safe and enjoy your stay in Hong Kong...

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Andy K
Reviews.Content: The staff was not as service minded as they should. Ridiculously small rooms, we had to keep one of our suitcases in the hall, hardly space to move inside, rock hard beds. Pretty poor standard in general. Even though it is fairly cheap, there is no value for the money in our opinion. You will find better alternatives out there. We were scheduled to stay for seven days and left after three, even though they had a no refund policy. By far the worst hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for people who arrive by train from the mainland or are heading for the mainland from Hong Kong as it is close to Hung Hom station. It is great value for money but I would not recommend it for someone on holiday as the rooms are small. No internet in room either but it is available near the office. Good hotel for sleeping not for holidaying. Staff are super friendly with perfect English.

Reviews.Title: “Quality but pokey room in good location”
Reviews.Author: 1985Adam1985
Reviews.Content: Simply great value for your cash. The rooms are tiny but for sleeping its what you want. Beds are a bit more tailored to smaller people but comfy by hong kong standards. ie. soft. Again bathroom is tiny but modern and clean and shower is just what you need. Internet is only gripe. Its only available in lobby or the tea room beside the lobby where plugs chairs and tables are available. Location is pretty good. Just outside the door on left there is a walkway which is easy to follow to Hung Hom mtr and the shopping center alongside and takes only 5mins or a little more with bags. To sum up its good value clean relatively well run hotel with easy access to all areas of city via mtr. Surrounding area is a little dull and there is a lot of florists about because of nearby undertaker but I don't think its a hotel to book on merit of the surroundings so its not a thing to knock the place for.

Reviews.Title: “Small room , reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Str1ke
Reviews.Content: Very small basic room but that is to be expected for the price. Good location short walk to station, plenty of restaurants around too. Rooms clean and tidy. Nothing flash , considering the price and location its not a bad choice if your on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, tiny, tiny”
Reviews.Author: WLeong
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers have already noted, the rooms were absolutely tiny - it's like living in a shoebox. Two good things, however. One, wi-fi (in the lobby area and the sitting area next door) was very dependable. Also, the hotel was within about an 8 minute walk to Hung Hom station and therefore well located. Bear in mind that if you wish to take the MTR over to Hong Kong island, there is a bit of walk to transfer at the East Tsim Sha Tsui (East TST)/Tsim Sha Tsui (TST stations. As you have to first exit the East TST station and then enter the TST station, purchase the Octopus card to enjoy a free transfer, or else transfer at Nam Cheong for Hong Kong MTR station. It would be very hard to stay here if you have a lot of luggage (you'd have to be very creative in 'squeezing out' space in the room). For two people in the standard double, once we've placed our bags on the floor, there was no way the door would be able to open fully. I would not recommend two people in the standard room unless you were on a shoestring budget like we were! Beware if you are a light sleeper as the walls are thin and you will be woken up by people moving about in the morning. Then again, if you are a price sensitive traveller, but want the convenience of a central Kowloon location, this is probably about as good a deal as you can get. Not entirely satisfying, I know, but that's the reality of Hong Kong hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm... small... but ok... maybe overpriced...could be great ?”
Reviews.Author: passion4u
Reviews.Content: This one is tough because I actually booked it by accident so that might have normally been a negative but it was my fault :) (was supposed to have booked the other location Sham Shui Po) Anyway hes the rooms are small I was alone and if you are travelling with someone you need more than the basic room, its great for just one person or perhaps someone you might meet for a few hours :) (Thats a JOKE :) LOL) PS - there is a Mcdonalds but it s a bit of a hike and the staff won't give you great directions - Its left and then keeping going straight almost until you can't go then I made a right and found it :) It is not perfectly clean but its fine shower has everything you need nice hot water and soap and mugs but if you have a large suitcase and want to move around its almost like doing it in a phone booth I truly feel that for the price you should have WIFI in the rooms rather than in an area at the lobby seperated ffrom the hotel The staff at the front door are nice but always busy and it's about a 10 minute walk IF you know where you are going. Anyone who just arrives at Hung Hum station might have issues especially if its dark as you have to go outside cross some busses and then down a bridge on your left and its quite close in the middle of a bunch of places that look like funeral parlours. They were nice enough to let me use their adapter and such so it was an ok stay not the disaster I thought as I was booked here by accident :) Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Practical stay for budget”
Reviews.Author: tommisis
Reviews.Content: Room was very small, just enough for bed and bathroom. But it was clean. The location was good, few minutes walk to Hung Hom MRT station and also bus station (bus A21 to/from airport). Couple nice breakfast places was nearby. But if you need a cheap place to sleep and keep your luggages, this is good place for that.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: kellios
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located around a district full of funeral parlors. The concept of the hotel (Bridal Tea House) is quite odd, I dont really get it. These two factors combined made the stay a sort of weird/morbid/interesting experience. The room is very very small but cozy and clean. The hotel is situated about 10 mins walk from Hung Hom MRT and terminus, which is a plus point. (I stayed here in Dec 2008, but there was no option provided for this date)

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest room I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jokoxd
Reviews.Content: By Hong Kong standards, this is one of the lower end hotels and I got what I paid for. It's within walking distance of the Hung Hom MRT station and has lots of eateries nearby. However, the room itself was the smallest one I've stayed in thus far. There's barely any floor space and I only brought one medium sized duffel bag. 3 out of the 4 nights, the guests staying next door were extremely loud and since the walls are very thin, I had trouble falling asleep. I would probably go somewhere else if I visit Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Two beds for single person only”
Reviews.Author: jellyvox
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via www.sinohotel.com reservation service. The cost of reservation was USD105 per day and it was about 2 times higher against the reservation cost right at the lobby (USD60)! I wanted to book the hotel at the lobby and required Sinohotel to return money but they refused. I will never use this company again! The apartments were the smallest ones I've ever seen. There were 2 beds (beds were quite good), tiny thermo electric cooler about 15 liter capacity, electric kettle, 3 coat hangers, TV on the wall and a telephone. There were no table no chair, no space for luggage I had. But thanks god the apartment had toilet and a shower and it was quite OK for a single traveler - one can use one of the beds to keep the luggage and clothes. For the couple the apartment are too small and is not convenient. The hotel has Wi-Fi but you can use it only in the room next to entrance to the hotel. So I had to leave my room at 22nd floor and go down to reach Wi-Fi spot each time. The view from the window was quite good - right to HK Island. The hotel in not far from MTR station and from the ferry (about 20 min to go) and its location is much better than it could be expected from the map of HK. The area is a dormitory one and you can find there food stores and cafes with reasonable price - much more moderate than in a districts near Nathan road for instance. So this hotel may be quite a good choice for those single travelers who want to stay in HK at moderate budget. But do not book this hotel via Internet reservation services at least via Sinohotel. Better call the hotel directly.The direct price is a fair one.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: berlin_style
Reviews.Content: This Bridial Tea House is located at Winslow St, only a five minute walk to Hung Hom MTR station. Unfortunately the ride to central Hong Kong requires a change. Rooms are small, but ok for Hong Kong, don’t bring to much luggage. The beds are compfy, but the room and the bathroom are clean only on the first sight. Further looking shows spots and hairs from previous travellers. There are amenities provided, such as water bottles, toothbrush and paste, slippers etc. There is also a microwave oven on the floor. Check in and out was seamless. Our fridge wasn't working; although I asked multiple times, the problem was not fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: WELSHYPM
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES Hotel like most in Hong Kong is well served by bus to get you to down town Kowloon. Hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from the MTR Hung Hom/Kowloon-Guangzhou Railway Station. Rooms well cleaned and stocked with usuals. Easily identifiable from a distance sticks out like a sore thumb. NEGATIVES Noisy air conditioning. Rooms are very small with limited storage facilities. "Office area" doubled as clothes hanging area. Windows frosted. Ideal for a short stay - 5/7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great value for money”
Reviews.Author: carrowsmith
Reviews.Content: As others have said the rooms are very small, apart from that its the perfect place to stay in HK, quiet well placed for the train traveller rather than the main hot spots on Kowloon such as Nathan Road. Best of all its really cheap, free bottled water and its only a short walk to the main station, science and history museums (free on Wednesday!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: spermie100
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was well placed about 5 mins from Hung Hom Station as well as about 20 minutes to get to the north end ferry. The rooms are pretty small but were clean. Was kind of hoping for bigger after a 16 hour flight. Beds were thick foam but still very confortable. Room equipped with fridge and all necessities. Only have english programming every now and then on the 4 stations available. Wifi only available in the lobby where only 2 chairs are available which I found inconvenient. The neighbourhood was quiet after business hours yet still close to nightlife if thats what youre looking for. Besides the fact I found the room very small, I would stay at this hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Bridal Tea House Hotel (Hung Hom - Winslow Street)
HotelInfo.Address: No.57-61 Winslow Street, Hung Hom, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
